text.p: These are the main stories in Latvian newspapers on Thursday. Prepared for Reuters by the Co-operation Fund. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prime Minister Andris Shkele met with representatives of the government forming factions to discuss amendments to the draft budget.
- The Committee for National Security believes that press reports on the arrest of an alleged Latvian intelligence agent in Kaliningrad has nothing to do with Latvia's state security institutions .
- President of the Bank of Latvia forecasts a drop of the annual inflation rate below ten percent over the next two years.
- The Latvian Police celebrates its 78th anniversary.
